Title: Shell to quit all involvement in Russian oil and gas, starting with spot crude purchases
Description: Shell said today that it intends to withdraw its involvement in all Russian hydrocarbons, including crude oil, petroleum products gas and LNG, in a phased manner, in line with new government guidance.
Author: CK

Title: Sakhalin Energy to offer a late April LNG cargo; Japanese buyers wary of Russian spot cargoes
Description: Sakhalin Energy is expected to issue a tender tomorrow to sell one cargo that will load on Apr. 22 at the 10.9 mtpa Sakhalin LNG plant on Russiaâ€™s Sakhalin Island. But, it is unclear who will take the cargo as many buyers grow wary of buying Russian LNG amid the sanctions placed on Russia for its unprovoked invasion of Ukraine.
Author: CK

Title: FID for Corpus Christi Stage 3 LNG project expected in summer: Cheniere
Description: US LNG exporter Cheniere has signed a deal with Bechtel for a turnkey engineering, procurement and construction (EPC) contract for the Corpus Christi Stage 3 LNG project and also directed the firm to begin work at the site under a limited notice to proceed (LNTP). The agreement paves the way for a final investment decision on the project this summer.
Author: CK

Title: Russia threatens cutting gas from Nord Stream 1 to Europe
Description: Russia has threatened to cut gas supplies to Europe through its 55 bn m3 Nord Stream 1 gas pipeline in response to the severe sanctions placed on Russia for its invasion of Ukraine, but has not yet made such a decision.
Author: CK
